   20: -module(seq_trace_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: -export([token_set_get/1, tracer_set_get/1, print/1,
   26:          old_heap_token/1,mature_heap_token/1,
   27: 	 send/1, distributed_send/1, recv/1, distributed_recv/1,
   28: 	 trace_exit/1, distributed_exit/1, call/1, port/1,
   29:          port_clean_token/1,
   30: 	 match_set_seq_token/1, gc_seq_token/1,
   31:          send_literal/1,inherit_on_spawn/1,inherit_on_dist_spawn/1,
   32:          dist_spawn_error/1]).
   33: 
   34: %% internal exports
   35: -export([simple_tracer/2, one_time_receiver/0, one_time_receiver/1,
   36:          n_time_receiver/1,
   37: 	 start_tracer/0, stop_tracer/1, 
   38: 	 do_match_set_seq_token/1, do_gc_seq_token/1, countdown_start/2]).
   39: 
   40: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   41: 
   42: -define(TIMESTAMP_MODES, [no_timestamp,
   43: 			  timestamp,
   44: 			  monotonic_timestamp,
   45: 			  strict_monotonic_timestamp]).
   46: 
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   49:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [token_set_get, tracer_set_get, print, send, send_literal,
   53:      distributed_send, recv, distributed_recv, trace_exit,
   54:      old_heap_token, mature_heap_token,
   55:      distributed_exit, call, port, match_set_seq_token,
   56:      port_clean_token,
   57:      gc_seq_token,
   58:      inherit_on_spawn, inherit_on_dist_spawn, dist_spawn_error].
   59: 
   60: groups() -> 
   61:     [].
   62: 
   63: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   64:     Config.
   65: 
   66: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   67:     ok.
   68: 
   69: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   70:     Config.
   71: 
   72: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   73:     Config.
   74: 
   75: 
   76: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   77:     Config.
   78: 
   79: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   80:     ok.
   81: 
   82: %% Verifies that the set_token and get_token functions work as expected
   83: 
   84: token_set_get(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   85:     do_token_set_get(timestamp),
   86:     do_token_set_get(monotonic_timestamp),
   87:     do_token_set_get(strict_monotonic_timestamp).
   88: 
   89: -define(SEQ_TRACE_SEND, 1).                     %(1 << 0)
   90: -define(SEQ_TRACE_RECEIVE, 2).                  %(1 << 1)
   91: -define(SEQ_TRACE_PRINT, 4).                    %(1 << 2)
   92: -define(SEQ_TRACE_NOW_TIMESTAMP, 8).            %(1 << 3)
   93: -define(SEQ_TRACE_STRICT_MON_TIMESTAMP, 16).    %(1 << 4)
   94: -define(SEQ_TRACE_MON_TIMESTAMP, 32).           %(1 << 5)
   95: 
   96: do_token_set_get(TsType) ->
   97:     BaseOpts = ?SEQ_TRACE_SEND bor
   98:                ?SEQ_TRACE_RECEIVE bor
   99:                ?SEQ_TRACE_PRINT,
  100:     Flags = case TsType of
  101:         timestamp ->
  102:             BaseOpts bor ?SEQ_TRACE_NOW_TIMESTAMP;
  103:         strict_monotonic_timestamp ->
  104:             BaseOpts bor ?SEQ_TRACE_STRICT_MON_TIMESTAMP;
  105:         monotonic_timestamp ->
  106:             BaseOpts bor ?SEQ_TRACE_MON_TIMESTAMP
  107:         end,
  108:     ct:pal("Type ~p, flags = ~p~n", [TsType, Flags]),
  109:     Self = self(),
  110:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  111:     %% Test that initial seq_trace is disabled
  112:     [] = seq_trace:get_token(),
  113:     %% Test setting and reading the different fields
  114:     0 = seq_trace:set_token(label,{my_label,1}),
  115:     {label,{my_label,1}} = seq_trace:get_token(label),
  116:     false = seq_trace:set_token(print,true),
  117:     {print,true} = seq_trace:get_token(print),
  118:     false = seq_trace:set_token(send,true),
  119:     {send,true} = seq_trace:get_token(send),
  120:     false = seq_trace:set_token('receive',true),
  121:     {'receive',true} = seq_trace:get_token('receive'),
  122:     false = seq_trace:set_token(TsType,true),
  123:     {TsType,true} = seq_trace:get_token(TsType),
  124:     %% Check the whole token
  125:     {Flags,{my_label,1},0,Self,0} = seq_trace:get_token(), % all flags are set
  126:     %% Test setting and reading the 'serial' field
  127:     {0,0} = seq_trace:set_token(serial,{3,5}),
  128:     {serial,{3,5}} = seq_trace:get_token(serial),
  129:     %% Check the whole token, test that a whole token can be set and get
  130:     {Flags,{my_label,1},5,Self,3} = seq_trace:get_token(),
  131:     seq_trace:set_token({Flags,19,7,Self,5}),
  132:     {Flags,19,7,Self,5} = seq_trace:get_token(),
  133:     %% Check that receive timeout does not reset token
  134:     receive after 0 -> ok end,
  135:     {Flags,19,7,Self,5} = seq_trace:get_token(),
  136:     %% Check that token can be unset
  137:     {Flags,19,7,Self,5} = seq_trace:set_token([]),
  138:     [] = seq_trace:get_token(),
  139:     %% Check that Previous serial counter survived unset token
  140:     0 = seq_trace:set_token(label, 17),
  141:     {0,17,0,Self,5} = seq_trace:get_token(),
  142:     %% Check that reset_trace resets the token and clears
  143:     %% the Previous serial counter
  144:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  145:     [] = seq_trace:get_token(),
  146:     0 = seq_trace:set_token(label, 19),
  147:     {0,19,0,Self,0} = seq_trace:get_token(),
  148:     %% Cleanup
  149:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  150:     ok.
  151: 
  152: tracer_set_get(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  153:     Self = self(),
  154:     seq_trace:set_system_tracer(self()),
  155:     Self = seq_trace:get_system_tracer(),
  156:     Self = seq_trace:set_system_tracer(false),
  157:     false = seq_trace:get_system_tracer(),
  158: 
  159:     %% Set the system tracer to a port.
  160: 
  161:     Port = load_tracer(Config),
  162:     seq_trace:set_system_tracer(Port),
  163:     Port = seq_trace:get_system_tracer(),
  164:     Port = seq_trace:set_system_tracer(false),
  165:     false = seq_trace:get_system_tracer(),
  166:     ok.
  167: 
  168: print(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  169:     [do_print(TsType, Label) || TsType <- ?TIMESTAMP_MODES,
  170:                                 Label <- [17, "label"]].
  171:     
  172: do_print(TsType, Label) ->
  173:     start_tracer(),
  174:     seq_trace:set_token(label, Label),
  175:     set_token_flags([print, TsType]),
  176:     seq_trace:print(Label,print1),
  177:     seq_trace:print(1,print2),
  178:     seq_trace:print(print3),
  179:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  180:     [{Label,{print,_,_,[],print1}, Ts0},
  181:      {Label,{print,_,_,[],print3}, Ts1}] = stop_tracer(2),
  182:     check_ts(TsType, Ts0),
  183:     check_ts(TsType, Ts1).
  184: 
  185: send(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  186:     lists:foreach(fun do_send/1, ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  187: 
  188: do_send(TsType) ->
  189:     do_send(TsType, send).
  190: 
  191: do_send(TsType, Msg) ->
  192:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  193:     start_tracer(),
  194:     Tester = self(),
  195:     Receiver = spawn(fun () ->
  196:                              A = alias(),
  197:                              Tester ! {alias, A},
  198:                              n_time_receiver(3)
  199:                      end),
  200:     Alias = receive {alias, A} -> A end,
  201:     register(n_time_receiver, Receiver),
  202:     Label = make_ref(),
  203:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Label),
  204:     set_token_flags([send, TsType]),
  205:     Receiver ! Msg,
  206:     n_time_receiver ! Msg,
  207:     Alias ! Msg,
  208:     Self = self(),
  209:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  210:     [{Label,{send,_,Self,Receiver,Msg}, Ts1},
  211:      %% Apparently named local destination process is traced as pid (!?)
  212:      {Label,{send,_,Self,Receiver,Msg}, Ts2},
  213:      {Label,{send,_,Self,Alias,Msg}, Ts3}
  214:     ] = stop_tracer(3),
  215:     check_ts(TsType, Ts1),
  216:     check_ts(TsType, Ts2),
  217:     check_ts(TsType, Ts3).
  218: 
  219: 
  220: %% This testcase tests that we do not segfault when we have a
  221: %% literal as the message and the message is copied onto the
  222: %% heap during a GC.
  223: send_literal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  224:     lists:foreach(fun do_send_literal/1,
  225:                   [atom, make_ref(), ets:new(hej,[]), 1 bsl 64,
  226:                    "gurka", {tuple,test,with,#{}}, #{}]).
  227: 
  228: do_send_literal(Msg) ->
  229:     N = 10000,
  230:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  231:     start_tracer(),
  232:     Label = make_ref(),
  233:     Receiver = spawn_link(fun() -> receive ok -> ok end end),
  234:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Label),
  235:     set_token_flags([send, 'receive', no_timestamp]),
  236:     [Receiver ! Msg || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
  237:     erlang:garbage_collect(Receiver),
  238:     [Receiver ! Msg || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
  239:     erlang:garbage_collect(Receiver),
  240:     Self = self(),
  241:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  242:     [{Label,{send,_,Self,Receiver,Msg}, Ts} | _] = stop_tracer(N),
  243:     check_ts(no_timestamp, Ts).
  244: 
  245: distributed_send(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  246:     lists:foreach(fun do_distributed_send/1, ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  247: 
  248: do_distributed_send(TsType) ->
  249:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  250:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  251:     start_tracer(),
  252:     Tester = self(),
  253:     Receiver = spawn(Node,
  254:                      fun () ->
  255:                              A = alias(),
  256:                              Tester ! {alias, A},
  257:                              n_time_receiver(3)
  258:                      end),
  259:     Alias = receive {alias, A} -> A end,
  260:     true = rpc:call(Node,erlang,register,[n_time_receiver, Receiver]),
  261: 
  262:     %% Make sure complex labels survive the trip.
  263:     Label = make_ref(),
  264:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Label),
  265:     set_token_flags([send,TsType]),
  266: 
  267:     Receiver ! send,
  268:     {n_time_receiver, Node} ! "dsend",
  269:     Alias ! "alias_dsend",
  270: 
  271:     Self = self(),
  272:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  273:     peer:stop(Peer),
  274:     [{Label,{send,_,Self,Receiver,send}, Ts1},
  275:      {Label,{send,_,Self,{n_time_receiver,Node}, "dsend"}, Ts2},
  276:      {Label,{send,_,Self,Alias,"alias_dsend"}, Ts3}
  277:     ] = stop_tracer(3),
  278: 
  279:     check_ts(TsType, Ts1),
  280:     check_ts(TsType, Ts2),
  281:     check_ts(TsType, Ts3).
  282: 
  283: 
  284: recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  285:     lists:foreach(fun do_recv/1, ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  286: 
  287: do_recv(TsType) ->
  288:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  289:     start_tracer(),
  290:     Tester = self(),
  291:     Receiver = spawn(fun () ->
  292:                              A = alias([reply]),
  293:                              Tester ! {alias, A},
  294:                              n_time_receiver(2)
  295:                      end),
  296:     Alias = receive {alias, A} -> A end,
  297:     set_token_flags(['receive',TsType]),
  298:     Alias ! 'alias_receive',
  299:     Alias ! 'alias_no_receive',
  300:     Receiver ! 'receive',
  301:     %% let the other process receive the message:
  302:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  303:     Self = self(),
  304:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  305:     [{0,{'receive',_,Self,Receiver,'alias_receive'}, Ts1},
  306:      {0,{'receive',_,Self,Receiver,'receive'}, Ts2}] = stop_tracer(2),
  307:     check_ts(TsType, Ts1),
  308:     check_ts(TsType, Ts2).
  309: 
  310: distributed_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  311:     lists:foreach(fun do_distributed_recv/1, ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  312: 
  313: do_distributed_recv(TsType) ->
  314:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  315:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  316:     rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,start_tracer,[]),
  317:     Tester = self(),
  318:     Receiver = spawn(Node,
  319:                      fun () ->
  320:                              A = alias([reply]),
  321:                              Tester ! {alias, A},
  322:                              n_time_receiver(2)
  323:                      end),
  324:     Alias = receive {alias, A} -> A end,
  325: 
  326:     %% Make sure complex labels survive the trip.
  327:     Label = make_ref(),
  328:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Label),
  329:     set_token_flags(['receive',TsType]),
  330: 
  331:     Alias ! 'alias_receive',
  332:     Alias ! 'alias_no_receive',
  333:     Receiver ! 'receive',
  334: 
  335:     %% let the other process receive the message:
  336:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  337:     Self = self(),
  338:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  339:     Result = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,stop_tracer,[2]),
  340:     peer:stop(Peer),
  341:     ok = io:format("~p~n",[Result]),
  342:     [{Label,{'receive',_,Self,Receiver,'alias_receive'}, Ts1},
  343:      {Label,{'receive',_,Self,Receiver,'receive'}, Ts2}] = Result,
  344:     check_ts(TsType, Ts1),
  345:     check_ts(TsType, Ts2).
  346: 
  347: trace_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  348:     lists:foreach(fun do_trace_exit/1, ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  349: 
  350: do_trace_exit(TsType) ->
  351:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  352:     start_tracer(),
  353:     Receiver = spawn_link(?MODULE, one_time_receiver, [exit]),
  354:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  355: 
  356:     %% Make sure complex labels survive the trip.
  357:     Label = make_ref(),
  358:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Label),
  359:     set_token_flags([send, TsType]),
  360: 
  361:     Receiver ! {before, exit},
  362:     %% let the other process receive the message:
  363:     receive
  364: 	      {'EXIT', Receiver, {exit, {before, exit}}} ->
  365: 		  seq_trace:set_token([]);
  366: 	      Other ->
  367: 		  seq_trace:set_token([]),
  368: 		  ct:fail({received, Other})
  369: 	  end,
  370:     Self = self(),
  371:     Result = stop_tracer(2),
  372:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  373:     ok = io:format("~p~n", [Result]),
  374:     [{Label, {send, {0,1}, Self, Receiver, {before, exit}}, Ts0},
  375: 	   {Label, {send, {1,2}, Receiver, Self,
  376: 	       {'EXIT', Receiver, {exit, {before, exit}}}}, Ts1}] = Result,
  377:     check_ts(TsType, Ts0),
  378:     check_ts(TsType, Ts1).
  379: 
  380: distributed_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  381:     lists:foreach(fun do_distributed_exit/1, ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  382: 
  383: do_distributed_exit(TsType) ->
  384:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  385:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  386:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, start_tracer,[]),
  387:     Receiver = spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, one_time_receiver, [exit]),
  388:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  389:     set_token_flags([send, TsType]),
  390:     Receiver ! {before, exit},
  391:     %% let the other process receive the message:
  392:     receive
  393: 	      {'EXIT', Receiver, {exit, {before, exit}}} ->
  394: 		  seq_trace:set_token([]);
  395: 	      Other ->
  396: 		  seq_trace:set_token([]),
  397: 		  ct:fail({received, Other})
  398: 	  end,
  399:     Self = self(),
  400:     Result = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, stop_tracer, [1]),
  401:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  402:     process_flag(trap_exit, false),
  403:     peer:stop(Peer),
  404:     ok = io:format("~p~n", [Result]),
  405:     [{0, {send, {1, 2}, Receiver, Self,
  406: 		{'EXIT', Receiver, {exit, {before, exit}}}}, Ts}] = Result,
  407:     check_ts(TsType, Ts).
  408: 
  409: call(doc) ->
  410:     "Tests special forms {is_seq_trace} and {get_seq_token} "
  411: 	"in trace match specs.";
  412: call(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  413:     Self = self(),
  414:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  415:     TrA = transparent_tracer(),
  416:     1 =
  417: 	erlang:trace(Self, true, 
  418: 		     [call, set_on_spawn, {tracer, TrA(pid)}]),
  419:     1 =
  420: 	erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, call_tracee_1, 1},
  421: 			     [{'_',
  422: 			       [],
  423: 			       [{message, {{{self}, {get_seq_token}}}}]}],
  424: 			     [local]),
  425:     1 =
  426: 	erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, call_tracee_2, 1},
  427: 			     [{'_',
  428: 			      [{is_seq_trace}],
  429: 			      [{message, {{{self}, {get_seq_token}}}}]}],
  430: 			     [local]),
  431:     RefA = make_ref(),
  432:     Pid2A = spawn_link(
  433: 		    fun() ->
  434: 			    receive {_, msg, RefA} -> ok end,
  435: 			    RefA = call_tracee_2(RefA),
  436: 			    Self ! {self(), msg, RefA}
  437: 		   end),
  438:     Pid1A = spawn_link(
  439: 		    fun() ->
  440: 			    receive {_, msg, RefA} -> ok end,
  441: 			    RefA = call_tracee_1(RefA),
  442: 			    Pid2A ! {self(), msg, RefA}
  443: 		    end),
  444:     Pid1A ! {Self, msg, RefA},
  445:     %% The message is passed Self -> Pid1B -> Pid2B -> Self.
  446:     %% Traced functions are called in Pid1B and Pid2B. 
  447:     receive {Pid2A, msg, RefA} -> ok end,
  448:     %% Only call_tracee1 will be traced since the guard for 
  449:     %% call_tracee2 requires a sequential trace. The trace
  450:     %% token is undefined.
  451:     Token2A = [],
  452:     {ok, [{trace, Pid1A, call,
  453: 		 {?MODULE, call_tracee_1, [RefA]},
  454: 		 {Pid1A, Token2A}}]} = 
  455: 	TrA({stop, 1}),
  456: 
  457:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  458: 
  459:     TrB = transparent_tracer(),
  460:     1 =
  461: 	erlang:trace(Self, true, 
  462: 		     [call, set_on_spawn, {tracer, TrB(pid)}]),
  463:     RefB = make_ref(),
  464:     Pid2B = spawn_link(
  465: 		    fun() ->
  466: 			    receive {_, msg, RefB} -> ok end,
  467: 			    RefB = call_tracee_2(RefB),
  468: 			    Self ! {self(), msg, RefB}
  469: 		   end),
  470:     Pid1B = spawn_link(
  471: 		    fun() ->
  472: 			    receive {_, msg, RefB} -> ok end,
  473: 			    RefB = call_tracee_1(RefB),
  474: 			    Pid2B ! {self(), msg, RefB}
  475: 		    end),
  476: 
  477:     %% The token is set *AFTER* spawning to make sure we're testing that the
  478:     %% token follows on send and not that it inherits on spawn.
  479:     Label = 17,
  480:     seq_trace:set_token(label, Label),
  481: 
  482:     Pid1B ! {Self, msg, RefB},
  483:     %% The message is passed Self -> Pid1B -> Pid2B -> Self, and the 
  484:     %% seq_trace token follows invisibly. Traced functions are 
  485:     %% called in Pid1B and Pid2B. Seq_trace flags == 0 so no
  486:     %% seq_trace messages are generated.
  487:     receive {Pid2B, msg, RefB} -> ok end,
  488:     %% The values of these counters {.., 1, _, 0}, {.., 2, _, 1}
  489:     %% depend on that seq_trace has been reset just before this test.
  490:     Token1B = {0, Label, 1, Self, 0},
  491:     Token2B = {0, Label, 2, Pid1B, 1},
  492:     {ok, [{trace, Pid1B, call,
  493: 		 {?MODULE, call_tracee_1, [RefB]},
  494: 		 {Pid1B, Token1B}},
  495: 		{trace, Pid2B, call, 
  496: 		 {?MODULE, call_tracee_2, [RefB]},
  497: 		 {Pid2B, Token2B}}]} =
  498: 	TrB({stop,2}),
  499:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  500:     ok.
  501: 
  502: %% The token should follow spawn, just like it follows messages.
  503: inherit_on_spawn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  504:     lists:foreach(
  505:       fun (Test) ->
  506:               lists:foreach(
  507:                 fun (TraceFlags) ->
  508:                         inherit_on_spawn_test(Test, TraceFlags)
  509:                 end,
  510:                 combinations(spawn_trace_flags()))
  511:       end,
  512:       [spawn, spawn_link, spawn_monitor,
  513:        spawn_opt, spawn_request]),
  514:     ok.
  515: 
  516: inherit_on_spawn_test(Spawn, TraceFlags) ->
  517:     io:format("Testing ~p() with ~p trace flags~n", [Spawn, TraceFlags]),
  518: 
  519:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  520:     start_tracer(),
  521:     start_spawn_tracer(TraceFlags),
  522: 
  523:     Ref = make_ref(),
  524:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Ref),
  525:     set_token_flags([send,'receive',strict_monotonic_timestamp]),
  526: 
  527:     Self = self(),
  528:     GurkaMsg = {gurka,Ref},
  529:     SpawnFun = fun() -> Self ! GurkaMsg, receive after infinity -> ok end end,
  530:     {Other, Tag, KnownReqId, KnownSpawnReply}
  531:         = case Spawn of
  532:               spawn ->
  533:                   {spawn(SpawnFun), spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  534:               spawn_link ->
  535:                   {spawn_link(SpawnFun), spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  536:               spawn_monitor ->
  537:                   {P, _} = spawn_monitor(SpawnFun),
  538:                   {P, spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  539:               spawn_opt ->
  540:                   {spawn_opt(SpawnFun, [link]), spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  541:               spawn_request ->
  542:                   SReply = make_ref(),
  543:                   RID = spawn_request(SpawnFun, [link, {reply_tag, SReply}]),
  544:                   receive
  545:                       {SReply, RID, ok, P} = M ->
  546:                           {P, SReply, RID, M}
  547:                   end
  548:           end,
  549: 
  550:     receive {gurka,Ref} -> ok end,
  551:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  552:     erlang:trace(self(),false,[procs|TraceFlags]),
  553: 
  554:     Sequence = lists:keysort(3, stop_tracer(6)),
  555:     io:format("Sequence: ~p~n", [Sequence]),
  556:     [SSpawnRequest, RSpawnRequest, SSpawnReply, RSpawnReply,
  557:      SGurkaMsg, RGurkaMsg] = Sequence,
  558: 
  559:     %% Spawn request...
  560:      {Ref,
  561:       {send,
  562:        {0,1},
  563:        Self,Other,
  564:        ReqMessage},
  565:       _} = SSpawnRequest,
  566:     
  567:     spawn_request = element(1, ReqMessage),
  568:     ReqId = element(2, ReqMessage),
  569:     case KnownReqId of
  570:         undefined -> ok;
  571:         ReqId -> ok
  572:     end,
  573: 
  574:      {Ref,
  575:       {'receive',
  576:        {0,1},
  577:        Self,Other,
  578:        ReqMessage},
  579:       _} = RSpawnRequest,
  580: 
  581:     %% Spawn reply...
  582:     SpawnReply = {Tag,ReqId,ok,Other},
  583:     {Ref,
  584:      {send,
  585:       {1,2},
  586:       Other,Self,
  587:       SpawnReply},
  588:      _} = SSpawnReply,
  589: 
  590:     case KnownSpawnReply of
  591:         undefined -> ok;
  592:         SpawnReply -> ok
  593:     end,
  594: 
  595:     {Ref,
  596:      {'receive',
  597:       {1,2},
  598:       Other,Self,
  599:       SpawnReply},
  600:      _} = RSpawnReply,
  601: 
  602:      %% Gurka message...
  603:      {Ref,
  604:       {send,
  605:        {1,3},
  606:        Other, Self,
  607:        GurkaMsg},
  608:       _} = SGurkaMsg,
  609: 
  610:      {Ref,
  611:       {'receive',
  612:        {1,3},
  613:        Other, Self,
  614:        GurkaMsg},
  615:       _} = RGurkaMsg,
  616: 
  617: 
  618:     Links = not(spawn =:= spawn orelse Spawn =:= spawn_monitor),
  619:     SoL = lists:member(set_on_link,TraceFlags) orelse
  620:         lists:member(set_on_first_link,TraceFlags),
  621:     SoS = lists:member(set_on_spawn,TraceFlags) orelse
  622:         lists:member(set_on_first_sapwn,TraceFlags),
  623: 
  624:     NoTraceMessages =
  625:         if
  626:             SoS andalso Links ->
  627:                 4;
  628:             SoS andalso not Links ->
  629:                 2;
  630:             SoL andalso Links ->
  631:                 4;
  632:             SoL andalso not Links->
  633:                 1;
  634:             Links andalso not SoL andalso not SoS ->
  635:                 2;
  636:             not Links andalso not SoL andalso not SoS ->
  637:                 1
  638:         end,
  639: 
  640:     TraceMessages = stop_spawn_tracer(NoTraceMessages),
  641: 
  642:     unlink(Other),
  643:     exit(Other, kill),
  644: 
  645: 
  646:     ok.
  647: 
  648: inherit_on_dist_spawn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  649:     lists:foreach(fun (Test) ->
  650:                           inherit_on_dist_spawn_test(Test)
  651:                   end,
  652:                   [spawn, spawn_link, spawn_monitor,
  653:                    spawn_opt, spawn_request]),
  654:     ok.
  655: 
  656: inherit_on_dist_spawn_test(Spawn) ->
  657:     io:format("Testing ~p()~n", [Spawn]),
  658:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  659:     %% ensure module is loaded on remote node...
  660:     _ = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, module_info, []),
  661: 
  662:     io:format("Self=~p~n",[self()]),
  663: 
  664:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  665:     start_tracer(),
  666:     rpc:call(Node, seq_trace, reset_trace, []),
  667:     start_tracer(Node),
  668: 
  669:     Ref = make_ref(),
  670:     io:format("Ref=~p~n",[Ref]),
  671: 
  672:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Ref),
  673:     set_token_flags([send,'receive',strict_monotonic_timestamp]),
  674: 
  675:     Self = self(),
  676: 
  677:     GurkaMsg = {gurka,Ref},
  678:     SpawnFun = fun() -> Self ! GurkaMsg, receive after infinity -> ok end end,
  679:     {Other, Tag, KnownReqId, KnownSpawnReply}
  680:         = case Spawn of
  681:               spawn ->
  682:                   {spawn(Node, SpawnFun), spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  683:               spawn_link ->
  684:                   {spawn_link(Node, SpawnFun), spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  685:               spawn_monitor ->
  686:                   {P, _} = spawn_monitor(Node, SpawnFun),
  687:                   {P, spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  688:               spawn_opt ->
  689:                   {spawn_opt(Node, SpawnFun, [link]), spawn_reply, undefined, undefined};
  690:               spawn_request ->
  691:                   SReply = make_ref(),
  692:                   RID = spawn_request(Node, SpawnFun, [{reply_tag, SReply}, link]),
  693:                   receive
  694:                       {SReply, RID, ok, P} = M ->
  695:                           {P, SReply, RID, M}
  696:                   end
  697:           end,
  698: 
  699:     receive GurkaMsg -> ok end,
  700:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  701: 
  702:     Sequence = lists:keysort(3,stop_tracer(4)),
  703:     io:format("Sequence: ~p~n", [Sequence]),
  704:     [StSpawnRequest, StAList, StSpawnReply, StGurkaMsg] = Sequence,
  705: 
  706:     %% Spawn request...
  707:      {Ref,
  708:       {send,
  709:        {0,1},
  710:        Self,Node,
  711:        ReqMessage},
  712:       _} = StSpawnRequest,
  713:     
  714:     spawn_request = element(1, ReqMessage),
  715:     ReqId = element(2, ReqMessage),
  716:     case KnownReqId of
  717:         undefined -> ok;
  718:         ReqId -> ok
  719:     end,
  720: 
  721:     {Ref,
  722:      {send,
  723:       {0,2},
  724:       Self,Node,
  725:       ArgList},
  726:      _} = StAList,
  727: 
  728:     %% Spawn reply...
  729:     SpawnReply = {Tag,ReqId,ok,Other},
  730:     case KnownSpawnReply of
  731:         undefined -> ok;
  732:         SpawnReply -> ok
  733:     end,
  734: 
  735:     {Ref,
  736:      {'receive',
  737:       {1,2},
  738:       Other,Self,
  739:       SpawnReply},
  740:      _} = StSpawnReply,
  741: 
  742:      %% Gurka message...
  743:      {Ref,
  744:       {'receive',
  745:        {2,3},
  746:        Other, Self,
  747:        GurkaMsg},
  748:       _} = StGurkaMsg,
  749: 
  750:     SequenceNode = lists:keysort(3,stop_tracer(Node, 4)),
  751:     io:format("SequenceNode: ~p~n", [SequenceNode]),
  752:     [StSpawnRequestNode, StSpawnReplyNode, StAListNode, StGurkaMsgNode] = SequenceNode,
  753: 
  754: 
  755:     %% Spawn request...
  756:      {Ref,
  757:       {'receive',
  758:        {0,1},
  759:        Self,Other,
  760:        ReqMessage},
  761:       _} = StSpawnRequestNode,
  762: 
  763:     %% Spawn reply...
  764:     {Ref,
  765:      {send,
  766:       {1,2},
  767:       Other,Self,
  768:       {spawn_reply, ReqId, ok, Other}},
  769:      _} = StSpawnReplyNode,
  770: 
  771:     {Ref,
  772:      {'receive',
  773:       {0,2},
  774:       Self,Other,
  775:       ArgList},
  776:      _} = StAListNode,
  777: 
  778:      %% Gurka message...
  779:      {Ref,
  780:       {send,
  781:        {2,3},
  782:        Other, Self,
  783:        GurkaMsg},
  784:       _} = StGurkaMsgNode,
  785: 
  786:     unlink(Other),
  787: 
  788:     peer:stop(Peer),
  789: 
  790:     ok.
  791: 
  792: dist_spawn_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  793:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  794:     %% ensure module is loaded on remote node...
  795:     _ = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, module_info, []),
  796: 
  797:     io:format("Self=~p~n",[self()]),
  798: 
  799:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  800:     start_tracer(),
  801:     rpc:call(Node, seq_trace, reset_trace, []),
  802:     start_tracer(Node),
  803: 
  804:     Ref = make_ref(),
  805:     io:format("Ref=~p~n",[Ref]),
  806: 
  807:     seq_trace:set_token(label,Ref),
  808:     set_token_flags([send,'receive',strict_monotonic_timestamp]),
  809: 
  810:     Self = self(),
  811:     SpawnReplyTag = make_ref(),
  812:     GurkaMsg = {gurka,Ref},
  813:     ReqId = spawn_request(Node,
  814:                           fun () ->
  815:                                   Self ! GurkaMsg,
  816:                                   receive after infinity -> ok end
  817:                           end,
  818:                           [lunk, {reply_tag, SpawnReplyTag}, link]),
  819: 
  820:     receive
  821:         {SpawnReplyTag, ReqId, ResType, Err} ->
  822:             error = ResType,
  823:             badopt = Err
  824:     end,
  825: 
  826:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  827: 
  828:     Sequence = lists:keysort(3,stop_tracer(3)),
  829:     io:format("Sequence: ~p~n", [Sequence]),
  830:     [StSpawnRequest, StAList, StSpawnReply] = Sequence,
  831: 
  832:     %% Spawn request...
  833:      {Ref,
  834:       {send,
  835:        {0,1},
  836:        Self,Node,
  837:        ReqMessage},
  838:       _} = StSpawnRequest,
  839:     
  840:     spawn_request = element(1, ReqMessage),
  841:     ReqId = element(2, ReqMessage),
  842: 
  843:     {Ref,
  844:      {send,
  845:       {0,2},
  846:       Self,Node,
  847:       _ArgList},
  848:      _} = StAList,
  849: 
  850:     %% Spawn reply...
  851:     ReplyMessage = {SpawnReplyTag,ReqId,error,badopt},
  852:     {Ref,
  853:      {'receive',
  854:       {1,2},
  855:       Node,Self,
  856:       ReplyMessage},
  857:      _} = StSpawnReply,
  858: 
  859:     SequenceNode = lists:keysort(3,stop_tracer(Node, 2)),
  860:     io:format("SequenceNode: ~p~n", [SequenceNode]),
  861:     [StSpawnRequestNode, StSpawnReplyNode] = SequenceNode,
  862: 
  863:     %% Spawn request...
  864:      {Ref,
  865:       {'receive',
  866:        {0,1},
  867:        Self,Node,
  868:        ReqMessage},
  869:       _} = StSpawnRequestNode,
  870: 
  871:     %% Spawn reply...
  872:     {Ref,
  873:      {send,
  874:       {1,2},
  875:       Node,Self,
  876:       {spawn_reply, ReqId, error, badopt}},
  877:      _} = StSpawnReplyNode,
  878: 
  879:     peer:stop(Peer),
  880: 
  881:     ok.
  882: 
  883: 
  884: %% Send trace messages to a port.
  885: port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  886:     lists:foreach(fun (TsType) -> do_port(TsType, Config) end,
  887: 		  ?TIMESTAMP_MODES).
  888: 
  889: do_port(TsType, Config) ->
  890:     io:format("Testing ~p~n",[TsType]),
  891:     Port = load_tracer(Config),
  892:     seq_trace:set_system_tracer(Port),
  893: 
  894:     set_token_flags([print, TsType]),
  895:     Small = [small,term],
  896:     seq_trace:print(0, Small),
  897:     case get_port_message(Port) of
  898: 	      {seq_trace,0,{print,_,_,[],Small}} when TsType == no_timestamp ->
  899: 		  ok;
  900: 	      {seq_trace,0,{print,_,_,[],Small},Ts0} when TsType /= no_timestamp ->
  901: 		  check_ts(TsType, Ts0),
  902: 		  ok;
  903: 	      Other ->
  904: 		  seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  905: 		  ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  906: 	  end,
  907:     %% OTP-4218 Messages from ports should not affect seq trace token.
  908:     %%
  909:     %% Check if trace token still is active on this process after
  910:     %% the get_port_message/1 above that receives from a port.
  911:     OtherSmall = [other | Small],
  912:     seq_trace:print(0, OtherSmall),
  913:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  914:     case get_port_message(Port) of
  915: 	      {seq_trace,0,{print,_,_,[],OtherSmall}} when TsType == no_timestamp ->
  916: 		  ok;
  917: 	      {seq_trace,0,{print,_,_,[],OtherSmall}, Ts1} when TsType /= no_timestamp ->
  918: 		  check_ts(TsType, Ts1),
  919: 		  ok;
  920: 	      Other1 ->
  921: 		  ct:fail({unexpected,Other1})
  922: 	  end,
  923: 
  924: 
  925:     seq_trace:set_token(print, true),
  926:     Huge = huge_data(),
  927:     seq_trace:print(0, Huge),
  928:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
  929:     case get_port_message(Port) of
  930: 	      {seq_trace,0,{print,_,_,[],Huge}} ->
  931: 		  ok;
  932: 	      Other2 ->
  933: 		  ct:fail({unexpected,Other2})
  934: 	  end,
  935:     unlink(Port),
  936:     exit(Port,kill),
  937:     ok.
  938: 
  939: get_port_message(Port) ->
  940:     receive
  941: 	{Port,{data,Bin}} when is_binary(Bin) ->
  942: 	    binary_to_term(Bin);
  943: 	Other ->
  944: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Other})
  945:     after 5000 ->
  946: 	    ct:fail(timeout)
  947:     end.
  948: 
  949: 
  950: %% OTP-15849 ERL-700
  951: %% Verify changing label on existing token when it resides on old heap.
  952: %% Bug caused faulty ref from old to new heap.
  953: old_heap_token(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  954:     seq_trace:set_token(label, 1),
  955:     erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, minor}]),
  956:     erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, minor}]),
  957:     %% Now token tuple should be on old-heap.
  958:     %% Set a new non-literal label which should reside on new-heap.
  959:     NewLabel = {self(), "new label"},
  960:     1 = seq_trace:set_token(label, NewLabel),
  961: 
  962:     %% If bug, we now have a ref from old to new heap. Yet another minor gc
  963:     %% will make that a ref to deallocated memory.
  964:     erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, minor}]),
  965:     {label,NewLabel} = seq_trace:get_token(label),
  966:     ok.
  967: 
  968: %% Verify changing label on existing token when it resides on mature heap.
  969: %% Bug caused faulty ref from old to new heap.
  970: mature_heap_token(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  971: 
  972:     seq_trace:set_token(label, 1),
  973:     erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, minor}]),
  974:     %% Now token should be on mature heap
  975:     %% Set a new non-literal label which should reside on new-heap.
  976:     NewLabel = {self(), "new label"},
  977:     seq_trace:set_token(label, NewLabel),
  978: 
  979:     %% If bug, we now have a ref from mature to new heap. If we now GC
  980:     %% twice the token will refer to deallocated memory.
  981:     erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, minor}]),
  982:     erlang:garbage_collect(self(), [{type, minor}]),
  983:     {label,NewLabel} = seq_trace:get_token(label),
  984:     ok.
  985: 
  986: 
  987: match_set_seq_token(doc) ->
  988:     ["Tests that match spec function set_seq_token does not "
  989:      "corrupt the heap"];
  990: match_set_seq_token(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  991:     Parent = self(),
  992: 
  993:     %% OTP-4222 Match spec 'set_seq_token' corrupts heap
  994:     %%
  995:     %% This test crashes the emulator if the bug in question is present,
  996:     %% it is therefore done in a slave node.
  997:     %%
  998:     %% All the timeout stuff is here to get decent accuracy of the error
  999:     %% return value, instead of just 'timeout'.
 1000:     %%
 1001:     {ok, Peer, Sandbox} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1002:     true = rpc:call(Sandbox, code, add_patha,
 1003: 			  [filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 1004:     Lbl = 4711,
 1005:     %% Do the possibly crashing test
 1006:     P1 =
 1007: 	spawn(
 1008: 	  fun () ->
 1009: 		  Parent ! {self(),
 1010: 			    rpc:call(Sandbox, 
 1011: 				     ?MODULE, do_match_set_seq_token, [Lbl])}
 1012: 	  end),
 1013:     %% Probe the node with a simple rpc request, to see if it is alive.
 1014:     P2 =
 1015: 	spawn(
 1016: 	  fun () ->
 1017: 		  receive after 4000 -> ok end,
 1018: 		  Parent ! {self(), rpc:call(Sandbox, erlang, abs, [-1])}
 1019: 	  end),
 1020:     %% If the test node hangs completely, this timer expires.
 1021:     R3 = erlang:start_timer(8000, self(), void),
 1022:     %%
 1023:     {ok, Log} =
 1024: 	receive
 1025: 	    {P1, Result} ->
 1026: 		exit(P2, done),
 1027: 		erlang:cancel_timer(R3),
 1028: 		Result;
 1029: 	    {P2, 1} ->
 1030: 		exit(P1, timeout),
 1031: 		erlang:cancel_timer(R3),
 1032: 		{error, "Test process hung"};
 1033: 	    {timeout, R3, _} ->
 1034: 		exit(P1, timeout),
 1035: 		exit(P2, timeout),
 1036: 		{error, "Test node hung"}
 1037: 	end,
 1038: 
 1039:     %% Sort the log on Pid, as events from different processes
 1040:     %% are not guaranteed to arrive in a certain order to the
 1041:     %% tracer
 1042:     SortedLog = lists:keysort(2, Log),
 1043: 
 1044:     ok = check_match_set_seq_token_log(Lbl, SortedLog),
 1045:     %%
 1046:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1047:     ok.
 1048: 
 1049: %% OTP-4222 Match spec 'set_seq_token' corrupts heap
 1050: %%
 1051: %% The crashing test goes as follows:
 1052: %%
 1053: %% One trigger function calls match spec function {set_seq_token, _, _},
 1054: %% which when faulty corrupts the heap. It is assured that the process
 1055: %% in question has a big heap and recently garbage collected so there 
 1056: %% will be room on the heap, which is necessary for the crash to happen.
 1057: %%
 1058: %% Then two processes bounces a few messages between each other, and if
 1059: %% the heap is crashed the emulator crashes, or the triggering process's
 1060: %% loop data gets corrupted so the loop never ends.
 1061: do_match_set_seq_token(Label) ->
 1062:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
 1063:     Tr = transparent_tracer(),
 1064:     TrPid = Tr(pid),
 1065:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, '_', '_'}, 
 1066: 			 [{'_', 
 1067: 			   [{is_seq_trace}], 
 1068: 			   [{message, {get_seq_token}}]}], 
 1069: 			 [local]),
 1070:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, countdown, 2}, 
 1071: 			 [{'_', 
 1072: 			   [], 
 1073: 			   [{set_seq_token, label, Label},
 1074: 			    {message, {get_seq_token}}]}],
 1075: 			 [local]),
 1076:     erlang:trace(new, true, [call, {tracer, TrPid}]),
 1077:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1078:     Bounce = spawn(fun () -> bounce(Ref) end),
 1079:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Bounce),
 1080:     _Countdown = erlang:spawn_opt(?MODULE, countdown_start, [Bounce, Ref],
 1081: 				 [{min_heap_size, 4192}]),
 1082:     receive 
 1083: 	{'DOWN', Mref, _, _, normal} -> 
 1084: 	    Result = Tr({stop, 0}),
 1085: 	    seq_trace:reset_trace(),
 1086: 	    erlang:trace(new, false, [call]),
 1087: 	    Result;
 1088: 	{'DOWN', Mref, _, _, Reason} ->
 1089: 	    Tr({stop, 0}),
 1090: 	    seq_trace:reset_trace(),
 1091: 	    erlang:trace(new, false, [call]),
 1092: 	    {error, Reason}
 1093:     end.
 1094: 
 1095: check_match_set_seq_token_log(
 1096:   Label,
 1097:   [{trace,B,call,{?MODULE,bounce,   [Ref]},    {0,Label,2,B,1}},
 1098:    {trace,B,call,{?MODULE,bounce,   [Ref]},    {0,Label,4,B,3}},
 1099:    {trace,B,call,{?MODULE,bounce,   [Ref]},    {0,Label,6,B,5}},
 1100:    {trace,C,call,{?MODULE,countdown,[B,Ref]},  {0,Label,0,C,0}},
 1101:    {trace,C,call,{?MODULE,countdown,[B,Ref,3]},{0,Label,0,C,0}},
 1102:    {trace,C,call,{?MODULE,countdown,[B,Ref,2]},{0,Label,2,B,1}},
 1103:    {trace,C,call,{?MODULE,countdown,[B,Ref,1]},{0,Label,4,B,3}},
 1104:    {trace,C,call,{?MODULE,countdown,[B,Ref,0]},{0,Label,6,B,5}}
 1105:   ]) ->
 1106:     ok;
 1107: check_match_set_seq_token_log(_Label, Log) ->
 1108:     {error, Log}.
 1109: 
 1110: countdown_start(Bounce, Ref) ->
 1111:     %% This gc and the increased heap size of this process ensures that
 1112:     %% the match spec executed for countdown/2 has got heap space for
 1113:     %% the trace token, so the heap gets trashed according to OTP-4222.
 1114:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1115:     countdown(Bounce, Ref).
 1116: 
 1117: countdown(Bounce, Ref) ->
 1118:     countdown(Bounce, Ref, 3).
 1119: 
 1120: countdown(Bounce, Ref, 0) ->
 1121:     Bounce ! Ref;
 1122: countdown(Bounce, Ref, Cnt) ->
 1123:     Tag = make_ref(),
 1124:     Bounce ! {Ref, self(), {Tag, Cnt}},
 1125:     receive {Tag, Cnt} -> countdown(Bounce, Ref, Cnt-1) end.
 1126: 
 1127: bounce(Ref) ->
 1128:     receive 
 1129: 	Ref ->
 1130: 	    ok;
 1131: 	{Ref, Dest, Msg} ->
 1132: 	    Dest ! Msg,
 1133: 	    bounce(Ref)
 1134:     end.
 1135: 
 1136: 
 1137: 
 1138: gc_seq_token(doc) ->
 1139:     ["Tests that a seq_trace token on a message in the inqueue ",
 1140:      "can be garbage collected."];
 1141: gc_seq_token(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1142:     Parent = self(),
 1143: 
 1144:     %% OTP-4555 Seq trace token causes free mem read in gc
 1145:     %%
 1146:     %% This test crashes the emulator if the bug in question is present,
 1147:     %% it is therefore done in a slave node.
 1148:     %%
 1149:     %% All the timeout stuff is here to get decent accuracy of the error
 1150:     %% return value, instead of just 'timeout'.
 1151:     %%
 1152:     {ok, Peer, Sandbox} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1153:     true = rpc:call(Sandbox, code, add_patha,
 1154: 			  [filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 1155:     Label = 4711,
 1156:     %% Do the possibly crashing test
 1157:     P1 =
 1158: 	spawn(
 1159: 	  fun () ->
 1160:  		  Parent ! {self(),
 1161: 			    rpc:call(Sandbox, 
 1162: 				     ?MODULE, do_gc_seq_token, [Label])}
 1163: 	  end),
 1164:     %% Probe the node with a simple rpc request, to see if it is alive.
 1165:     P2 =
 1166: 	spawn(
 1167: 	  fun () ->
 1168: 		  receive after 4000 -> ok end,
 1169: 		  Parent ! {self(), rpc:call(Sandbox, erlang, abs, [-1])}
 1170: 	  end),
 1171:     %% If the test node hangs completely, this timer expires.
 1172:     R3 = erlang:start_timer(8000, self(), void),
 1173:     %%
 1174:     ok =
 1175: 	receive
 1176: 	    {P1, Result} ->
 1177: 		exit(P2, done),
 1178: 		erlang:cancel_timer(R3),
 1179: 		Result;
 1180: 	    {P2, 1} ->
 1181: 		exit(P1, timeout),
 1182: 		erlang:cancel_timer(R3),
 1183: 		{error, "Test process hung"};
 1184: 	    {timeout, R3, _} ->
 1185: 		exit(P1, timeout),
 1186: 		exit(P2, timeout),
 1187: 		{error, "Test node hung"}
 1188: 	end,
 1189:     %%
 1190:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1191:     ok.
 1192: 
 1193: do_gc_seq_token(Label) ->
 1194:     Parent = self(),
 1195:     Comment =       
 1196: 	{"OTP-4555 Seq trace token causes free mem read in gc\n"
 1197: 	 "\n"
 1198: 	 "The crashing test goes as follows:\n"
 1199: 	 "\n"
 1200: 	 "Put a message with seq_trace token in the inqueue,\n"
 1201: 	 "Grow the process heap big enough to become mmap'ed\n"
 1202: 	 "and force a garbage collection using large terms\n"
 1203: 	 "to get a test_heap instruction with a big size value.\n"
 1204: 	 "Then try to trick the heap into shrinking.\n"
 1205: 	 "\n"
 1206: 	 "All this to make the GC move the heap between memory blocks.\n"},
 1207:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
 1208:     Child = spawn_link(
 1209: 	      fun() ->
 1210: 		      receive {Parent, no_seq_trace_token} -> ok end,
 1211: 		      do_grow(Comment, 256*1024, []),
 1212: 		      do_shrink(10),
 1213: 		      receive {Parent, seq_trace_token} -> ok end,
 1214: 		      Parent ! {self(), {token, seq_trace:get_token(label)}}
 1215: 	      end),
 1216:     seq_trace:set_token(label, Label),
 1217:     Child ! {Parent, seq_trace_token},
 1218:     seq_trace:set_token([]),
 1219:     Child ! {Parent, no_seq_trace_token},
 1220:     receive 
 1221: 	{Child, {token, {label, Label}}} -> 
 1222: 	    ok;
 1223: 	{Child, {token, Other}} ->
 1224: 	    {error, Other}
 1225:     end.
 1226: 
 1227: do_grow(_, 0, Acc) ->
 1228:     Acc;
 1229: do_grow(E, N, Acc) ->
 1230:     do_grow(E, N-1, [E | Acc]).
 1231: 
 1232: do_shrink(0) ->
 1233:     ok;
 1234: do_shrink(N) ->
 1235:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1236:     do_shrink(N-1).
 1237: 
 1238: %% Test that messages from a port does not clear the token
 1239: port_clean_token(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1240:     seq_trace:reset_trace(),
 1241:     Label = make_ref(),
 1242:     seq_trace:set_token(label, Label),
 1243:     {label,Label} = seq_trace:get_token(label),
 1244: 
 1245:     %% Create a port and get messages from it
 1246:     %% We use os:cmd as a convenience as it does
 1247:     %% open_port, port_command, port_close and receives replies.
 1248:     %% Maybe it is not ideal to rely on the internal implementation
 1249:     %% of os:cmd but it will have to do.
 1250:     os:cmd("ls"),
 1251: 
 1252:     %% Make sure that the seq_trace token is still there
 1253:     {label,Label} = seq_trace:get_token(label),
 1254: 
 1255:     ok.
 1256: 
 1257: 
 1258: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1259: %% Internal help functions
 1260: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1261: 
 1262: %% Call trace targets
 1263: 
 1264: call_tracee_1(X) ->
 1265:     X.
 1266: 
 1267: call_tracee_2(X) ->
 1268:     X.
 1269: 
 1270: 
 1271: transparent_tracer() ->
 1272:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1273:     Loop = 
 1274: 	fun(Fun, Log, LN) ->
 1275: 		receive
 1276: 		    {stop, MinLN, Ref, From} when LN >= MinLN ->
 1277: 			From ! {log, Ref, lists:reverse(Log)};
 1278: 		    Entry when is_tuple(Entry) == false; element(1, Entry) /= stop ->
 1279: 			Fun(Fun, [Entry | Log], LN+1)
 1280: 		end
 1281: 	end,
 1282:     Self = self(),
 1283:     Pid = 
 1284: 	spawn(fun() ->
 1285: 		      seq_trace:set_system_tracer(self()),
 1286: 		      Self ! {started, Ref},
 1287: 		      Loop(Loop, [], 0) 
 1288: 	      end),
 1289:     receive {started, Ref} -> ok end,
 1290:     fun(pid) ->
 1291: 	    Pid;
 1292:        ({stop, N}) when is_integer(N), N >= 0 ->
 1293: 	    Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1294: 	    receive
 1295: 		{'DOWN', Mref, _, _, _} ->
 1296: 		    {error, not_started}
 1297: 	    after 0 ->
 1298: 		    DeliverRef = erlang:trace_delivered(all),
 1299: 		    receive
 1300: 			{trace_delivered,_,DeliverRef} -> ok
 1301: 		    end,
 1302: 		    Pid ! {stop, N, Ref, self()},
 1303: 		    receive {'DOWN', Mref, _, _, _} -> ok end,
 1304: 		    receive {log, Ref, Log} -> 
 1305: 			    {ok, Log} 
 1306: 		    end
 1307: 	    end
 1308:     end.
 1309: 
 1310: n_time_receiver(0) ->
 1311:     ok;
 1312: n_time_receiver(N) ->
 1313:     receive _Term -> n_time_receiver(N-1)
 1314:     end.
 1315: 
 1316: one_time_receiver() ->
 1317:     receive _Term -> ok
 1318:     end.
 1319: 	
 1320: one_time_receiver(exit) ->
 1321:     receive Term ->
 1322: 	    exit({exit, Term}) 
 1323:     end.
 1324: 
 1325: simple_tracer(Data, DN) ->
 1326:     receive
 1327: 	{seq_trace,Label,Info,Ts} ->
 1328: 	    simple_tracer([{Label,Info,Ts}|Data], DN+1);
 1329: 	{seq_trace,Label,Info} ->
 1330: 	    simple_tracer([{Label,Info, no_timestamp}|Data], DN+1);
 1331: 	{stop,N,From} when DN >= N ->
 1332: 	    From ! {tracerlog,lists:reverse(Data)}
 1333:     end.
 1334: 
 1335: stop_tracer(N) when is_integer(N) ->
 1336:     stop_tracer(node(), N).
 1337: 
 1338: stop_tracer(Node, N) when is_integer(N) ->
 1339:     case rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[seq_trace_SUITE_tracer]) of
 1340:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 1341:             unlink(Pid),
 1342:             Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1343:             Pid ! {stop,N,self()},
 1344:             receive
 1345:                 {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, noproc} ->
 1346:                     {error, not_started};
 1347:                 {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 1348:                     {error, Reason};
 1349:                 {tracerlog,Data} ->
 1350:                     erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush]),
 1351:                     Data
 1352:             after 5000 ->
 1353:                     erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush]),
 1354:                     {error,timeout}
 1355:             end;
 1356:         _ ->
 1357:             {error, not_started}
 1358:     end.
 1359: 
 1360: start_tracer() ->
 1361:     start_tracer(node()).
 1362: 
 1363: start_tracer(Node) ->
 1364:     Me = self(),
 1365:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1366:     Pid = spawn_link(Node,
 1367:                      fun () ->
 1368:                              Self = self(),
 1369:                              stop_tracer(0),
 1370:                              register(seq_trace_SUITE_tracer,Self),
 1371:                              seq_trace:set_system_tracer(Self),
 1372:                              Self = seq_trace:get_system_tracer(),
 1373:                              Me ! Ref,
 1374:                              simple_tracer([], 0)
 1375:                      end),
 1376:     receive
 1377:         Ref ->
 1378:             unlink(Pid),
 1379:             Pid
 1380:     end.
 1381: 
 1382: set_token_flags([]) ->
 1383:     ok;
 1384: set_token_flags([no_timestamp|Flags]) ->
 1385:     seq_trace:set_token(timestamp, false),
 1386:     seq_trace:set_token(monotonic_timestamp, false),
 1387:     seq_trace:set_token(strict_monotonic_timestamp, false),
 1388:     set_token_flags(Flags);
 1389: set_token_flags([Flag|Flags]) ->
 1390:     seq_trace:set_token(Flag, true),
 1391:     set_token_flags(Flags).
 1392: 
 1393: start_spawn_tracer(TraceFlags) ->
 1394: 
 1395:     %% Disable old trace flags
 1396:     erlang:trace(self(), false, spawn_trace_flags()),
 1397: 
 1398:     Me = self(),
 1399:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1400:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1401:             fun () ->
 1402:                     register(spawn_tracer, self()),
 1403:                     Me ! Ref,
 1404:                     (fun F(Data) ->
 1405:                              receive
 1406:                                  {get, N, StopRef, Pid} when N =< length(Data) ->
 1407:                                      Pid ! {lists:reverse(Data), StopRef};
 1408:                                  M when element(1,M) =:= trace ->
 1409:                                      F([M|Data])
 1410:                              end
 1411:                     end)([])
 1412:             end),
 1413:     receive
 1414:         Ref ->
 1415:             erlang:trace(self(),true,[{tracer,Pid}, procs | TraceFlags])
 1416:     end.
 1417: 
 1418: stop_spawn_tracer(N) ->
 1419:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1420:     spawn_tracer ! {get, N, Ref, self()},
 1421:     receive
 1422:         {Data, Ref} ->
 1423:             Data
 1424:     end.
 1425: 
 1426: spawn_trace_flags() ->
 1427:     [set_on_spawn, set_on_link, set_on_spawn,
 1428:      set_on_first_link, set_on_first_spawn].
 1429: 
 1430: combinations(Flags) ->
 1431:     %% Do a bit of sofs magic to create a list of lists with
 1432:     %% all the combinations of all the flags above
 1433:     Set = sofs:from_term(Flags),
 1434:     Product = sofs:product(list_to_tuple(lists:duplicate(length(Flags),Set))),
 1435:     Combinations = [lists:usort(tuple_to_list(T)) || T <- sofs:to_external(Product)],
 1436:     [[] | lists:usort(Combinations)].
 1437: 
 1438: check_ts(no_timestamp, Ts) ->
 1439:     try
 1440: 	no_timestamp = Ts
 1441:     catch
 1442: 	_ : _ ->
 1443: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_timestamp, Ts})
 1444:     end,
 1445:     ok;
 1446: check_ts(timestamp, Ts) ->
 1447:     try
 1448: 	{Ms,S,Us} = Ts,
 1449: 	true = is_integer(Ms),
 1450: 	true = is_integer(S),
 1451: 	true = is_integer(Us)
 1452:     catch
 1453: 	_ : _ ->
 1454: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_timestamp, Ts})
 1455:     end,
 1456:     ok;
 1457: check_ts(monotonic_timestamp, Ts) ->
 1458:     try
 1459: 	true = is_integer(Ts)
 1460:     catch
 1461: 	_ : _ ->
 1462: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_timestamp, Ts})
 1463:     end,
 1464:     ok;
 1465: check_ts(strict_monotonic_timestamp, Ts) ->
 1466:     try
 1467: 	{MT, UMI} = Ts,
 1468: 	true = is_integer(MT),
 1469: 	true = is_integer(UMI)
 1470:     catch
 1471: 	_ : _ ->
 1472: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_timestamp, Ts})
 1473:     end,
 1474:     ok.
 1475: 
 1476: load_tracer(Config) ->
 1477:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1478:     ok = erl_ddll:load_driver(Path, echo_drv),
 1479:     open_port({spawn,echo_drv}, [eof,binary]).
 1480: 
 1481: huge_data() -> huge_data(16384).
 1482: huge_data(0) -> [];
 1483: huge_data(N) when N rem 2 == 0 ->
 1484:     P = huge_data(N div 2),
 1485:     [P|P];
 1486: huge_data(N) ->
 1487:     P = huge_data(N div 2),
 1488:     [16#1234566,P|P].
